  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63649].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*

When an issue is closed, users cannot vote for it despite the jira.issue.editable property is set to true or absent.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a Ticket
# Log in as a different user
# Close the issue
# Attempt to vote for the issue

h3. *Expected Behaviour*
 
 User is able to vote.

h3. *Actual Behaviour*

User is unable to vote as the votes link is greyed out. 

h3. *Workaround*

# Reopen the ticket
# Vote for it
# Close the ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63640].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently importing project with Subtask from Trello using JIRA's External Import will result in following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

This happens because JIRA's subtask is named *Sub-Tasks*.

h3. Environment
6.4.12 -> JIRA 7.0.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open External System Import in JIRA
# Import Trello Project which contains subtask

h3. Expected Results
All the issues including subtask imported correctly with their respective issue type.

h3. Actual Results
User is prompted with the following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

h3.Workaround
Create task type Sub-Task with name "SubTask" for the Project imported from Trello
fields.summary: Trello Sub-Task Issue Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63638].
  {panel}

Add special cases when dealing with the Epic issue type.

* If the default/first issue type is Epic, pick another one.
* Don't consider Epic a valid issue type.
* If the only issue type is Epic, display an error.

This is because the Epic issue type is treated in a special way by JIRA Agile (and would mess up the board if we used it).

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary
User picker does not list all the users in a group, when filtered by group. The users that are not listed however, can be shown if you filter it further with the user's username, for instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Searching for a group with users in it, for example "anothergroup" which has 13 users (all users are in internal directory), 
# Attempt to filter by group name in the user picker browser 

h3. Expected results
It returns all the users in the group.

h3. Actual results
It only returns some of the users. This does not happen with the user browser in User Management.

h3. Notes
* This cannot be reproduced in vanilla instance, see restricted comment: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63624?focusedCommentId=1002393&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1002393
* When searching via the User Browser (i.e., admin page), the users found are filtered effectively at a DB level:
{code}SELECT lower_child_name FROM public.cwd_membership WHERE (directory_id =  '1' ) AND (lower_parent_name =  'anothergroup' ) AND (membership_type =  'GROUP_USER' ){code}
This correctly returns 13 users.

However, when searching for "anothergroup" via the user picker, here's the query that gets run on the DB:
{code}SELECT user_name FROM public.cwd_user WHERE (active =  '1' ) AND (directory_id =  '1' ) ORDER BY lower_user_name LIMIT 1000{code}
This returns all usernames in the database. The results are then filtered in memory. Thus, the bug seems to lies in the subsequent filtering that occurs within the user searcher in UserBrowserPicker class

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: userpicker browser does not return some users when filter by group

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63621].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

In JIRA Service Desk, it is possible to integrate the Confluence knowledge base to the issue navigator but for the issue collector, this is not possible. 

Having the knowledge base on the issue collector will allow user to refer to the documentations before raising issues via the collector; potentially saving customer time. 

It is a good feature to have!
fields.summary: Allow Confluence knowledge base to be embedded into JIRA issue collector

h3.Workaround
To work around the problem, one can copy the elements of the array into an ArrayList:

{code}

  #set($tmp = [])
  #foreach($item in $collection)

  #end
  #set($collection = $tmp)
#end

$arr.get(1)
{code}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63617].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when we have a long description or comment in activity tab we can see that there is a button called *show more* to display the rest of the comment or description as shown in the image below:
!showmore.png|thumbnail!

When we click on this show more link/button instead of showing the description or comment on the same activity tab JIRA brings us to the description or comment of the issue. 

h3. Suggested Solution
We have two suggestion solution for this behaviour as mentioned below:
# Display the description/comment on the activity tab when an user click *show more* instead of redirecting them to the description/comment box.
# If displaying the description/comment on the activity tab is not possible then provide a more meaningful name for the link such as *direct to issue* instead of *show more*

h3. Why this is important
The current behaviour is not logical as an user when we saw *show more* button we expect the details to be displayed in the same place instead of redirection.
 
h3. Workaround 

Currently no workaround is available for this behaviour
fields.summary: Provide feature to expand the Show More link in Activity tab for JIRA Issues

h3. Problem Definition
Audit logs can take a lot of space depending on the size of the instance. Certain users may audit logs for only a few day. However, JIRA can only be configured to have a minimum retention period of 1 month, 

h3. Suggested Solution
Give admins to set the retention period to few days or weeks depending on their need. 

h3. Why this is important
If the customer doesn't require more than a few days, then having audit logs taking much space to store one month of data isn't sensible.

  {panel}

Currently, the description of the "Schedule" issue permission in the scheme is 

*_"Ability to view or edit an issue's due date."_*

This is not complete because the "Schedule" permission is also required for an issue to be moved in the Backlog of the Scrum Board.

From the docs -

_"If you are moving the issue above or below other issues, you will need to have the 'Schedule Issue' permission in the project to which the issue belongs."_

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-sprints/adding-an-issue-to-a-sprint]

 

Thus, please update the description of "Schedule" permission in the permission scheme to incorporate the fact that this permission is also used by JIRA Agile in dragging/dropping of issues in the Backlog of scrum board.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63592].
  {panel}

h3. Environment
* Cloud backup that contains entries like {{assignee=""}}
* JIRA 7.2.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restore Cloud instance to JIRA 7.2.6 staging server to downgrade the data
# Create a backup of the downgraded instance data
# Attempt to restore a single project that has issues assigned to null

h3. Expected Results
# A message alerting us to this condition, along with resolution options is presented

h3. Actual Results
A validation error pops up advising that 1 required user could not be created. Upon clicking the *View Details* option a page will load showing the missing mandatory users, however it is blank.

h3.Workaround
Remove all occurrences of {{assignee=""}} from the backup prior to attempting the project import. 
(!) For nix users the following steps with sed will work:
# Unzip backup file
# Run {{sed -i 's/assignee=""//g' entities.xml}}
# Zip the backup back together {{zip fixed_backup.zip entities.xml activeobject.xml}} 
# Attempt the import

More on this workaround can be found in the following KB article:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Import+Failed+due+to+Blank+Missing+Mandatory+User
fields.summary: Null Assignee Haults Successful Project Import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63591].
  {panel}

h3. Description of problem
The time tracking report requires that the Fix Version field be shown in the field configuration associated with the issues being displayed in the report. This is not mentioned in the documentation.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/time-tracking-report-720416014.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/reporting-829092747.html
** It appears that the report is no longer documented on a separate page

h3. Suggested Improvement
Update current and older versions of documentation to include that the Fix Version field must be shown in the field configuration in order an issue to appear in the report. 

h3. Workaround
Change the field configuration to show the Fix Version field. If you do not want the field to appear you can remove it from screens.

h3. Additional Information
Versions are a built in component of the Time Tracking Report and the report configuration has a drop down to select version.The report finds issues using a filter. The filter in the background is the following:
{noformat}
(project = 10000) AND (fixVersion is EMPTY) order by remainingEstimate DESC
{noformat}
*  In this case "No Fix Version" is selected. 

The "fixVersion is EMPTY" part excludes all of the issues where the Fix Version field does not apply. These would be issues where the Fix Version field has been hidden in the field configuration.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report documentation missing fix version field requirement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63588].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever a backup of the workflow is being saved, the default name is in the format of
{{Copy 1 of workflow 1}}, the naming convention of the backup of the workflows is not helping users to sort the workflows and each copy easily.

All the workflow backups will be listed next to each other because each file name starts with "Copy _ of workflow _". For example,
{quote}
Copy 1 of workflow 1
Copy 1 of workflow 2
Copy 1 of workflow 3
Copy 2 of workflow 1
Copy 2 of workflow 2
Copy 2 of workflow 3
Workflow 1
Workflow 2
Workflow 3
{quote}


h3. Suggestion
It'd be great if the format can be changed and include the current date when the backup is saved, so that all workflows and each backup can be easily identified. For example,
{quote}
Workflow 1
Workflow 1 Copy 1 (13/12/2016)
Workflow 1 Copy 2 (20/12/2016)
Workflow 2
Workflow 2 Copy 1 (13/11/2016)
Workflow 3
{quote}
fields.summary: Change the default format of the backup workflow name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There's a regression in JIRA in the way how {{EagerOfBizUserCache}} is created on each new node and replicated to other nodes.

Currently, it's not warmed up so that the first thingy which deals with users (such as {{NodeReindexServiceThread}} reindexing issues) will start populating the {{EagerOfBizUserCache}}, cluster lock will be taken (and other locks, in the case of reindexing issues, {{DefaultIndexManager#indexLocks}}). It can take a while to complete, hence other threads may reach timeout when acquiring a lock (eg. {{ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread}} at {{com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup}}).

The previous behaviour was that the cache was populated before JIRA is fully-started.
 
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7+ Datacenter
 * >=3 nodes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # have a lot of users >=30000
 # have issues to reindex
 # start new node

h3. Expected Results
EagerOfBizUserCache is populated during JIRA startup and it's ready before JIRA is fully-started.

h3. Actual Results
EagerOfBizUserCache is populated after JIRA startup and it might block or slow down other operations, for example leads to index inconsistencies.

h3. Notes
h4. Example of the problem related to index lock timeout
*ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread* is waiting for *DefaultIndexManager* lock:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1" #85 prio=5 tid=0x00007fca257e9000 nid=0x5d32 waiting on condition [0x00007fc9a6df7000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000005c495cc08> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:785)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.access$600(DefaultIndexManager.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$IndexLock.tryLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:1118)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:354)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:118)
...
{code}

but *NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1* does {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.perform}} and then sync user cache with other nodes and holding the lock *DefaultIndexManager*:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1" #84 prio=5 tid=0x00007fca25a4c000 nid=0x5d31 runnable [0x00007fc9a6ef6000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.listRemoteCachePeers(JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.java:79)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.listRemoteCachePeers(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:335)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.replicatePutNotification(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.replication.rmi.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.replicateViaCopy(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.replication.rmi.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.notifyElementPut(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:48)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.internalNotifyElementPut(RegisteredEventListeners.java:192)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.notifyElementPut(RegisteredEventListeners.java:170)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.UserOrGroupCache.buildCacheIfRequired(UserOrGroupCache.java:118)
...
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.findUserByName(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.findUserByName(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:64)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.DefaultUserManager.getUserByName(DefaultUserManager.java:258)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.perform(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:282)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.reindexIssues(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:541)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:438)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateIssueIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:404)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.updateAffectedIndexes(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:298)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.reIndex(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:252)
...
{code}
 
h3. Workaround
When the actual problem is related to reaching index lock timeout, it can be increased (application property jira.index.lock.waittime).
fields.summary: JIRA Datacenter excessive EagerOfBizUserCache user cache population and replication on node start-up
Move "Cancel Re-Indexing" button to opposite end of the status bar

Early on in the call stack there is:

In this particular case we'll have field values that will now be desynced and also indexes different on each node.

# Run health-check (or empty JQL) and get status for each node

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63582].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When replying to a notification of a specific JIRA issue with Microsoft Outlook or adding a comment through email, a comment is added to the issue, but no notifications are sent to the watchers when the notification scheme is configured properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. With Outlook
 # Create a mail handler to a specific project
 # In Issue Commented (Notification Scheme), add a notification to _All Watchers_
 # Create an issue
 # Ensure to set a few users as watchers
 # Send an email out to JIRA's mail handler with the issue key of the step 3
 # A comment is added to the issue
 # No notifications are sent
 # The log files (atlassian-jira-outgoing) show noting even with debug

h3. Expected Behavior

The watchers should receive the notifications properly 
h3. Workaround

Use the web client
fields.summary: Notification not being sent when a new comment is added via email using the MS Outlook client

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63580].
  {panel}

+*Issue Summary*+

When a user adds {{jira.issue.editable=false}} to a workflow status, even if they add other workflow properties to the same status, the former would override every other property added to said status.

+*Steps To Reproduce*+

# Create a dummy project with a new workflow.
# In the *closed* status, add the property {{jira.issue.editable=false}}.
# Also add the property {{jira.permission.worklogeditown=true}}
# Create an issue.
# Transition the issue to the *closed* status.
# Attempt to log work.

+*Observation*+

You would not be able to log work because the jira.issue.editable=false has overridden the other property.

+*Feature Request*+

Can the workflow property be enhanced to allow priority to be given to specific properties based on their order?

For example, the highest property takes precedent over others. This would also allow user the opportunity to order their property as they deem fit.
fields.summary: Allow Other Workflow Properties Override jira.issue.editable=false

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63576].
  {panel}

I write a lot of tickets and spend a lot of time updating and changing those tickets.

Sometimes I hit escape either by accident, by force of habit from years of vim use, or because I think the focus is on a different window.

I often lose a lot of text without JIRA even giving me so much as a "Are you sure you wish to discard your changes? [Discard] [Continue editing]" window.

This happens to me almost every single day and often involves repeating a lot of work.

Please add this confirmation dialog box - I'm certain I'm not the only person this happens to.
fields.summary: Add confirmation box when discarding changes in Jira ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63575].
  {panel}

This issue was logged because it seems to be the fundamental thing in association of Attachments with Comments.  Being able to determine a directly uploaded attachment is also desirable.  None of this is current possible, leaving association down to informed guesswork.

Currently (7.x+) attachment can be uploaded through the Issue screen directly, and the Commenting box.  We need to be able to differentiate these, which is not currently possible.

The 'root' cause of this issue is that there is no association at the entity level between a Comment and an Attachment.  This is a fundamental requirement on which all historic issues that all would need this in order to be satisfied.
 * JRA-1844
 * JRA-17527
 * JRA-27872

Examples of possible workarounds are JRA-43448 to use timestamps to correlate on what attachments were added with a particular comment (unimplemented at this time).
h3. How it could work

a) When the comment is submitted, the comment ID is set on the attachments that were uploaded through it.  

b) When the comment is submitted the comment doesn't initially fire an event.  Attachments that were uploaded during the comment process have their timestamps reset (JRA-43448)

This means that when a Comment event (that usually completes long after attachments have completed upload /creation) occurs, the related attachments can be located.

Attachments uploaded directly are the problem case, as they could not be differentiated between the above.  We'd need to know they were uploaded directly.
fields.summary: Provide a relationship at the data level that an attachment was uploaded via the commenting UI or not

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63571].
  {panel}

Hi,

Can you _*please*_ mention in your help page on Content Reindexing ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-index-administration-148844.html)] that this function is not available to Cloud Confluence subscribers?

I struck a serious problem with Gliffy content today (new bug CONF-45614), for which all self-sourced solutions suggested I start with reindexing content, but no where does it mention (that I could see) that the feature isn't available to cloud subscribers.  Mauro has fixed my problem now with a workaround.

I lost hours today trying to find a way to reindex content in some way and also trying to find another possible solution - all because I was trying to avoid raising a ticket with tech support if a reindex (or another known fix) was all I needed to do.

A quick update to this page would be very helpful, especially when the Status Page [http://status.atlassian.com/] does not get updated for issues like this to explain to customers that a server-side issue exists (it still hasn't been updated) - so customers are just left in the dark.

Thanks.
fields.summary: "Content Reindexing" not available in Cloud Confluence Administration

h3. Issue Summary

Creating a sub-task using the *actions* drop down under _Issues in Epic_ will link the ticket back to the parent Epic ticket and not the selected issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an _issue in epic_.
 # Click the ⚙️ _Actions_ menu next to the new issue and select _Create sub-task_.
 # The sub-task will be created under the Epic instead of the selected issue.

h3. Expected Results

The sub-task will be created as a child of the issue selected within the epic.
h3. Actual Results

The sub-task is created as a child of the epic.
h3. Workaround
 # Open up the selected issue found under *Issues in Epic* in a new tab
 # Select More → _Create sub-tasks_
fields.summary: Create sub-task: should link new issue to the selected issue not the parent epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing an issue where the project sidebar is displayed on the left side, the issue's top buttons (transitions, summary, comment, edit) are not responsive, which causes them to not remain visible if you scroll down on the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a board;
# Open a issue on another page;
# Scroll down on the issue view page;

h3. Expected Results
The top issue buttons remain visible.

h3. Actual Results
The top issue buttons are not shown as you scroll down the page.

h3.Workaround
If an issue is opened through a method where the project sidebar is not displayed on the left side (be it opening an issue trough a JQL search, or simply adding {{?jql=}} to the end of the issue's URL), the top buttons will once again be responsive, being shown even when scrolling all the way down on the issue.

h3. Screenshots
Without workaround 
!WithoutWorkaround.png|thumbnail!        

With workaround
!Withworkaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Project sidebar keeps issue's top buttons from being responsive

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 2.1.12 instance health plugin adds a check for the presence of {{jira-healthcheck-eol.json}} in your jira home directory to check EOL date. If that file is not present on the system and the system cannot reach the marketplace to check EOL the health check plugin will not run and will throw an error of 'there was an error performing the instance health check' in the GUI.

!health_error.JPG|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the latest JIRA instance health plugin
# Check that {{jira-healthcheck-eol.json}} does not exist in JIRA_HOME
# remove the ability of the system to connect to the marketplace
#  Check the instance health tab in JIRA

h3. Expected Results

The check does not fail if the file does not exist, as the data is persisted somewhere else (e.g.: in the database) or the file is recreated automatically.

h3. Actual Results

The error "Unable to verify the End of Life date for version '7.2.x'. The check has not been performed." is returned, instead of performing the health check. An exception such as the below will appear in the logs:


{code:java}
SupportHealthCheckThread-6 WARN      [c.a.j.p.healthcheck.util.SupportEolCheckUtil] Not able to retrieve the JIRA version information from MPAC
{code}
Connection to MPAC fails and below stack trace can be seen:

{noformat}
2016-12-20 10:29:40,691 SupportHealthCheckThread-2 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.healthcheck.support.EolSupportHealthCheck] An error occurred when performing the EOL check, see the exceptions for more info
java.net.UnknownHostException: marketplace.atlassian.com: nodename nor servname provided, or not known
 	at java.net.Inet6AddressImpl.lookupAllHostAddr(Native Method)
 	at java.net.InetAddress$2.lookupAllHostAddr(InetAddress.java:928)
 	at java.net.InetAddress.getAddressesFromNameService(InetAddress.java:1323)

Plugins using the following syntax to render soy templates within velocity templates do not work:
  
{code:java}

h3. Problem Definition

When customer is trying to update/edit an issue, the following message shows up:

As a workaround to use the unavailable issue types, users would have to use the MOVE feature.

As a workaround, customers can add a "warning" into the Issue Type field description. To do so you can go to: Issues > Field Configuration > Issue Type > Edit.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63556].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
Both, cache replication and cluster nodes discovery in EhCache are sequential and synchronous.
 Time required to replicate values is proportional to number of nodes in cluster.

com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.replication.rmi.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator is a wrapper for net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator

We could use RMIAsynchronousCacheReplicator but it introduces numerous problems with backpressure and keeping soft references to objects waiting for replication.

*Solution:*
 Implement semi-async replication where:
 - fire async replication tasks for each node
 - block until all tasks are done

Implement parallel cluster nodes discovery

It would significantly reduce cache replication time for large clusters
fields.summary: Implement semi-async cache replication for EhCache in DC

From https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-data-center-802592197.html#InstallingJIRADataCenter-parametersCluster.propertiesfileparameters :
{quote}
Cluster.properties file parameters
You can set the following parameters in the cluster.properties file:
||Parameter||Required||Description/value||
|ehcache.peer.discovery|No|Describes how nodes find each other:
default - JIRA will automatically discover nodes. Recommended
automatic - Will use EhCache's multicast discovery. This is the historical default method used by ehCache, but can be problematic for customers to configure and is no longer recommended by Atlassian for use with JIRA clustering|
{quote}

As currently described we don't detail how JIRA will automatically discover nodes. Upon startup JIRA checks the clusternode table in its database in order to discover other nodes in the cluster

h3. Problem Definition
* Currently the session timeout completely removes the session and all unsaved data is lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow for a window prompt for re-logging in after a session timeout, keeping the previous session.

h3. Why this is important
* Users will not need to lose information through unattended idle.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63549].
  {panel}

I had an issue reported to me today, where a team member was not able to change the type of an issue. He was only being given a subset of the available issue type. The reason was the field configuration scheme, the issue type he wished to switch to was using a different field configuration scheme, the only issue types that were visible were those on the same field configuration scheme as the current issue type.

No indication was given as to why only a subset were visible. [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/some-issue-types-are-unavailable-due-to-incompatible-field-configuration-and-or-workflow-associations-278692623.html] This describes the issue in more detail.

The workaround is of course to use the move option instead, but this does not feel very intuitive.

I would suggest that:
 * All available issue types are available in the drop down (either inline ajax editing or the edit dialogue)
 * If switching to a type with a different field configuration scheme
 ** Inform the user of any fields that will lose their values as those fields do not exist on the new scheme
 ** Prompt the user to provide values for any new fields which are required by the new field configuration scheme
fields.summary: Improve support for switching issue types where the switch will also include switching field configuration scheme

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence, when entering a link "[urlA|urlB]", the expected behavior is for urlA to appear as the link text and takes the user to urlB. This can cause some confusion if it was done by mistake or any malicious intent. 


h3. Suggested Solution
If the *link text* looks like a URL (urlA), it should be forcefully synched with the underlying URL (urlB). So that the *link text* becomes urlB as well, such as seen here "[urlB|urlB]". This is to prevent confusion from occurring, as well as security issues associated with incorrect url redirection.
fields.summary: Link text that look a URL should be automatically synched with the underlying URL

Health-check index consistency check needs to be relaxed for JIRA.
For JIRA it will be false positive and give following alerts:
The issue index is inconsistent with the database state. The last issue update recorded in the database was at (Date) but the last issue update recorded in the index was at (Same Date)
The issue index is inconsistent with the database state. Database has (N) issues but the index has (N+1) issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63526].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When changing an Issue Type Scheme on a project, if some of the issue types of issues in the project are no longer covered by the new scheme, then a migration of issue types will occur. If there's a very large number of these issues, then the operation can take a large amount of time, which will cause gateway timeouts when using a reverse proxy.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Find a project with the order of 100000s of issues in one issue type
# Create an issue type scheme that does not include that issue type
# Change that project's issue type scheme to the new one not including that issue type, and go through the migration steps

h3. Expected Results

Issue types are migrated without issue.

h3. Actual Results

The URL takes so long to load that it causes gateway timeouts at the proxy server.

h3. Workaround

This workaround may require increasing the maximum number of issues in a bulk operation with the system property jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count - note that you may need to test in a staging environment to ensure that the resources consumed by this increase do not cause problems. You may need to perform this in batches rather than all at once, depending on how large the set of issues are that need to be changed.

# Create an issue type scheme that contains the full set of issue types from both your original and desired destination state
# Assign that issue type scheme to the project
# Use a bulk move operation to change the issue type of the affected issues
# Now assign the new issue type scheme to the project, without needing to run through the migration
fields.summary: Issue Type Scheme migration on large number of issues causes gateway timeout

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63523].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Data Center admin, the only solution to fix a Lucene Search Index consistency problem (The issue index is inconsistent with the database state. Database has (<issue-count-1>) issues but the index has (<issue-count-2>) issues.) is by either re-indexing the node or copying the index from another healthy node:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/healthcheck-lucene-search-indexes-740263412.html

h3. Suggested Solution
The health check should also include the option to fix the inconsistency or at least provide the list of issues affected by this problem. This would help admins to assess the best way to fix the inconsistency (e.g. using a project re-index).
fields.summary: As a JIRA Data Center admin, I'd like to know more details about issues causing the Lucene Search Indexes check to fail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63522].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When running the Log Analyzer in Support Tools it does not retrieve the RegEx XML file, so it will not match any KB / bugs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Schedule the log analyzer when there is a valid result in the logs for JIRA Service Desk (JSD).

h3. Expected Results

Results are returned for JSD.

h3. Actual Results

They're not.
fields.summary: Support Tools Plugin does not download the JIRA Service Desk RegEx file, so does not provide matches for JSD issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Filter Details view does not indicate that a filter is shared with "Any Logged-In user"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter, for example {{project = kan AND assignee = admin ORDER BY Rank ASC}}
 # Share this filter with "Any Logged-In users" and Save/Update the fitler
 # Return to the Issue navigator in JIRA and view this filter
 # Click the "Details" link at the top of the page to view more information on this filter

h3. Expected Results

This popup window should indicate that this filter has been shared with "Any logged-in users" under the permissions section.
h3. Actual Results

No indication is provided that this filter has been shared at all. There is an entry that
{quote}This filter is visible to:
 Project:
{quote}
h3. Notes

Tested and confirmed in 6.4.13 and 7.2.4, but likely exists in many other versions
h3. Workaround

none

!filterdetailssharebug.png|thumbnail!

!sharedwithfilter.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Filter Details view does not indicate that a filter is shared with "Any Logged-In user"

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Attaching a file with an invalid filename may result in a race condition causing tickets to be in the wrong status

 
h4. Steps to Reproduce

Configure jira in the following way:
 # Mail handlers:
 !mail-handlers.png|thumbnail!
 # SD automation to automatically reopen issue on comment
 !sd-automation.png|thumbnail!

Now when I create issue and resolve it.
 Then send email with file that contains invalid character eg. ":"
h4. Expected Behaviour

JIRA processes the e-mail correctly and re-opens the ticket from the e-mail update.
h4. Actual Behaviour

JIRA processes the e-mail, but causes the issue to be in the wrong status:
 * Notice that the ticket was transitioned to be "Waiting for support", but the status remains in  Resolved:
 !image-2016-12-13-15-37-35-101.png|thumbnail!

 
h4. Workaround

Manually access the issue ticket and trigger the transition within JIRA to the proper status.
fields.summary: Race condition in mail handler when attaching file with invalid filename leads to issue not being transitioned in workflow
